AUTHORS: Andre Filipe de Assuncao e Brito <decko@noisemakers.org> Original author
DESCRIPTION: With notify-send you can send desktop notifications to the user via a notification daemon from the command line. These notifications can be used to inform the user about an event or display some form of information without getting in the userâ€™s way.
NAME: notify-send - a program to send desktop notifications
OPTIONS: -u, --urgency=LEVEL Specifies the urgency level (low, normal, critical).
-t, --expire-time=TIME The duration, in milliseconds, for the notification to appear on screen.
(Ubuntu's Notify OSD and GNOME Shell both ignore this parameter.)
-i, --icon=ICON[,ICON...] Specifies an icon filename or stock icon to display.
-h, --hint=TYPE:NAME:VALUE Specifies basic extra data to pass. Valid types are INT, DOUBLE, STRING and BYTE.
SEE ALSO The Desktop Notification Spec on http://www.galago-project.org/specs/notification/.
